page.title: 10AXBRIDGE CHURCH
page.content: Outside{Axbridge Church}there is a set of steps which have been there for many years. At the bottom of the steps are two small wells which used to be the main village water supply. The wells are not now used but are still in good condition considering their age. When walking into the church you see the huge{Norman stone arches}which make the church seem bigger. The wooden pews are carved at each end. {The font}was made of stone in 1450. There is an example of plasterwork dating from 1636. The plastering of medieval{church roofs}developed during the late 16th century.In the early 17th century the patterning of the etchings became very elaborate.The church is mainly 15th century with a tower containing six bells.
